title: Intergrating sciences to sustain urban ecosystem services
abstractText:
The ISSUES seminar series was established to develop new links between disciplines and new collaborative relationships. Six interdisciplinary seminars were held between 2008 and 2010, five in the UK and one in Germany.

The ISSUES seminar series developed an active multi-disciplinary network, which included representatives from 18 universities, three research institutes, six Government departments and environmental regulators, three wildlife trusts, five environmental consultancies and six local/regional authorities.

The key finding to emerge from the seminars was the conclusion that the Ecosystem Service (ES) approach provides a workable framework for multi-discipline research and knowledge exchange. The seminars enabled participation in multi-disciplinary discussions and field-visits which directly informed the research of the participants. The novel application of an ES approach to an urban water setting was pioneered and resulted in publication of a peer-review journal paper, and the co-organisers went on to contribute to the major technical report The UK National Ecosystem Assessment published in 2011.
